A LNIB, unfired, awesome condition Knight KP-1 Utility Rifle chambered in .270 for trade only- Beautiful single shot action rifle in Next Generation camo/matte stainless (extremely hard to find) configuration- Comes equipped with hammer extension, KICK-EEZ recoil pad, drilled and tapped for scope mounts- This system features a "tang safety" type break action with user removeable trigger/hammer assembly, shell extractor, and forearm (all 3 are super easy to remove and replace), and is designed for interchangeable barrels like the TC Encore- I've owned three Encore/Pro Hunter rifles, and this one is by far the easiest and slickest to operate break action rifle I have ever owned! title: For Sale:  Wanna play Paintball? Want a one of a kind rifle? Come and take a look!
postcontent:
Whether your a new player, or an old wardog like myself, nothing makes the game more fun than a little more realism. Ever wanted to play sniper with your buddies in the woods? You know you have. 

Heres your chance to have a very cool, custom paintball rifle. This started out life as an Air Guns Design Automag paintball gun, a design and company known for reliability and consistency since the earliest days of the sport. It was then modified into a rifle, with a reworked but extremely simple trigger mechanism and a horizontal feed tube running to the right side of the barrel that holds 15 rounds, and feeds them via a spring that pushes the next into the chamber, originally this was 20 rounds but at some point it was cut down in order to make the barrel change easier. 20 dollars on Ebay can get you another body to use a hopper.

I must stess that its seen a pretty extensive amount of play and the paint could use a refinish, or if your like me, like the well worn look, leave it as is.

The specs:
This automag rifle sports a  14-16 inch barrel made by Palmers Pursuit Shop, one of the most renown and hard working air smith companies in the sport, with a long heritage of quality behind everything they make. It is Stainless Steel and built like a tank. Also included is an automag to AUTOCOCKER barrel adaptor, should the barrel not prove to be good enough, simply pop in the adaptor and utilize the MOST used barrel threading in the sport.
What I believe is a Nikon scope, Im not good with scopes when I cannot see the name, but its clear as day and very good. Whatever it is, its overkill for paintball, but the adjustable power and looks make it effective as both a spotter scope, and of course, the intimidation factor.
10/22 Stocks: This rifle is built to drop straight into a 10/22 stock, some might require fitting but for the most part, it'll be a perfect fit without any trouble. The only thing you may have to do is remove any threaded bushing in the stock, or slightly open up the hole.
All-in-one: Unlike most paintball 'rifle' builds that require the use of a remote line to a tank on the users back, this rifle is completely self sustainable. a small co2 tank is mounted under the stock and can feed the rifle for more than enough shots for a day of play or so.
The feedtube: It can be loaded by hand, or through the use of ten round tubes sort of like stripper clips work. I have some of these.

The bad stuff:
The finish is flaking with age, if you dont like that look, you may wish to repaint it.
Due to its conversion, it can be a little finicky on occasion and will not fire, this is almost always remidied by barely unscrewing the screw  pictured. Over tightening this screw binds something in the action, this is not uncommon for automags in general however.
The Stock has seen better days, its a little wobbly in the rear end due to it being a rather cheap ATI stock thats been tapped for screws to secure the air tank, and the screw that holds the action into it had pulled through before I purchased it, I have remedied this with a small plate under it that secures it fine however.
The feed tube, due to it being cut down at some point, has not had the back cap pinned into place, I never did it because I had intentions to return it to its original length but never did to due to a theft in my shop.
The trigger guard is just, well, ugly. Its a piece of thin aluminum cut and bent into shape, rather crude, but ultimately effective.
The tape, is simply for looks and to make it a little easier to grasp, the bit on the stock however is covering a hole I filled in, at some point the previous owner attempted to route the air through the stock for some reason. 

A warning about owning Automags: They have a completely dead trigger until gas is applied, its not broken, its just how they all work.

Want a full setup? Add 50 and I've got a nice mask and a great camo pouch and belt.


The problem child screw:




If interested, Call or text at REDACTED. Price is semi-OBO.

title: For Sale:  Yugo M57 Tokarev 7.62x25mm with 9mm barrel, comp, ammo, extras
postcontent:
For sale is a Yugoslavian Model 57 Tokarev in 7.62x25mm. I would estimate it to be ~90% condition finish due to the "idiot mark" where the add-on thumb safety used to go. The only thing missing is the add-on thumb safety. Imported by PW Arms - I am the first US owner of this fine shooting handgun.

Includes the following:
-Yugo M57 Tokarev 7.62x25mm military surplus pistol (C&R eligible), shiny bore
-1 original military surplus M57 magazine (100% reliable)
-3 US-made M57 magazines (not 100% reliable in my experience)
-9mm drop-in conversion barrel from Numrich
-GunPartsWarehouse Tokarev compensator (replaces stock barrel bushing, usable in either 7.62x25mm or 9mm)
-140 rounds of Yugoslavian FMJ surplus Tokarev pistol ammo (brass cased, corrosive primed)
-100 rounds of PPU FMJ brass-cased, non-corrosive commercial ammo
-used blue Beretta plastic pistol case

Basically, for what you would pay for a cosmoline-covered surplus M57 shipped to your door (if you have a C&R license like I do) you get all the extras, ability to shoot 9mm, and 240 rounds of Tokarev ammo (the Yugo FMJ is nearly impossible to find now).

Buyer must be legally able to purchase and own a handgun, and must be willing to sign a sales receipt similar to the one at the following link:

title: For Sale:  Winchester Black Talon 9mm (The True Story)
postcontent: This is two boxes of Winchester Black Talon 9mm Luger 147 Gr. SXT Deep Penetrator ammunition 20 cartridges to a box. Originally designed and released in 1991 this cartridge was the first to include a pre-scored jacket. It also included a reverse taper design which allowed it's signature talons to be released perpendicular to the bullet upon impact. The black color of the bullet comes from the oxidized copper jacket and the LubaLox coating which was new for Winchester at the time. LubaLox protects the rifling of the barrel as well as provides lubrication for the bullet while traveling the length of the barrel. It is still used on many of their cartridges today minus the black color. In all Black Talon was cutting edge technology for it's time, thee best hollow point on the market. After a few mass shootings Black Talon proved it's effectiveness but in an unfortunately negative light. Without even being on the market for two years Winchester decided it was in the company's best interest to pull the Black Talon line in 1993. However the Black Talon bullet was re-incarnated into brass casings and sold in boxes of 50 to law enforcement only up until 2000 under the name Ranger SXT which stood for (Supreme eXpansion Talon) but the media once again criticized the "Talon" name into nonexistence and it became known as (Supreme eXpansion Technology) a much more "politically correct" term. Although the Black Talon's days seemed over Winchester released a new cartridge in 2009 following the design nearly identically with some modern advancements. This new cartridge which was also part of the Supreme Elite Series, same as the Black Talon is know as PDX1. PDX1 is debatablely one of the best cartridges on the market today, so much so that it is the ammunition of choice by the FBI. So what it comes down to is own a piece of Winchester history for $45 a box. I will also ship UPS with tracking for $5 more. I hope you at least found my ad informative, thanks for looking.

LNIB: WALTHER PPS (POLICE PISTOL SLIM) 9MM 2 MAGS CASE AND ALL MANUALS $550 OBO EMAIL OR CALL TXT REDACTED MUST SHOW VALID DL AND CARRY PERMIT TO BUY OR TRADE.


Walther PPS is short recoil operated, locked breech pistol that uses modified Browning type locking with tilting barrel. Frame of the gun is made from impact resistant polymer. Trigger is of double action only type, striker fired, with pre-cocked striker system, similar to QA system used in Walther P99 pistols. This system requires a manual recocking (by partial slide retraction) in the case of misfire. Gun is fitted with automated trigger safety and firing pin block; additional "storage type" safety is provided by removable backstrap of the grip; once backstrap is removed, the firing pin is automatically decocked and gun is blocked until the backstrap is reinstalled. This patented system is called QuickSafe by Walther. Sights are low profile, with rear sight adjustable for windage.

title: For Sale:  Ruger 357 Maximum 10.5" barrel + box + 200 rounds of ammo
postcontent:
PRICE DROP

For sale is a very uncommon Ruger in .357 Maximum (not Magnum, but will shoot them) with the even more uncommon 10.5" barrel.
The 357 Maximum is .400" longer than the 357 Magnum, delivering up to 400 more ft/lbs of energy.
The Maximum is just a longer version of the Magnum and it will shoot those and 38 Special rounds.
This caliber Ruger was produced for only a couple of years before it was shuffled into obscurity because loads using 125 grain bullets that would do flame cutting into the top strap through the b/c gap.
Rounds should have 158 grain or larger bullets to avoid a deep flame cut.
Years later it was eventually found that even with 125 grain bullets the cut created would not grow any more, and that did not weaken the structure of the gun.

This gun is obviously a long enough barrel for hunting with plenty of power.
If you are looking for one to do silhouette shooting - look no further; that's what this was designed for.
The trigger pull has been significantly lightened to fit with the length/weight combination and provide much tighter groups.
With over a foot of distance between the sights, I have no trouble grouping at 100 yards.
One final note on this baby is that it is the only one John Linebaugh can convert to the 475 or 500 Linebaugh Long.

The second picture shows my ability with it from 100 yards standing...

I will require proof of residency for a FTF sale by Drivers License or State Identification card and will provide a bill of sale (copies for each).

**  Final note:  The ammo is hand-loaded and is included to provide .357 Maximum brass.  Use at your own risk.

title: For Sale:  AMT (Galena) Automag IV 45 Winchester Magnum
postcontent:
PRICE DROP

Here is a rare AMT (Galena) Automag IV 45 Winchester Magnum

This one is in excellent condition and runs like a champ!
There is some light wear on the bottom forward section of the slide like it was shot off a bag.
(A bag is not needed; I shoot/practice with my AM IV's standing, both single and double handed at 50 yards.)
This one has a 6" barrel to be legal for handgun hunting (in most places) and plenty of power to take down deer or piggies.
The 45 Win Mag (in my opinion) is around the largest and most manageable of the big bore semi-auto's. 
Because it is a 100% stainless steel semi-auto (about 3.25 lbs unloaded), felt recoil is less than that of most 44 Magnum revolvers.
Ammo is commercially available; I've seen it on shelves and many places online.

If you reload here is some information...
Rounds use the same bullet as 45 Colt, CH/4D had dies on the shelf and new Starline brass is readily available.
(You really you only need a resizing die for 45 Win Mag; 45/454/460 dies work for all others.)

title: For Sale:  ||||| Defensive Pistol 1 Classes with CarryLegal.com |||||
postcontent:
CarryLegal.com invites you to attend one of our DP1 & DP2 classes. You only have a few opportunities left this year!!
 Our class dates are:
 DP1- September 8th, September 16th, October 6th, & November 3rd.
 DP2- October 20th
 Register online, or call             918-237-2063      . These classes WILL fill quickly! Reserve your seat today!!


Here are a few of the questions we have designed the Defensive Pistol course curriculum to specifically address: 

• Do I know what type of people commit crimes, how they commit them, who they commit them against, and how to spot tell-tale signs of a crime about to happen? 
•Is my pistol a defensive tool I know how to competently operate, or am I merely expecting its mere presence and noise when fired to stop an attack? 
•Am I a good enough shot to consistently hit what I'm aiming at without endangering those around me? 
•What if one or two shots aren't enough to stop an assailant? What if ten shots isn't enough? 


COURSE OVERVIEW: 

Defensive Pistol 1 is one full day of training including lecture, practical exercises, and live fire on the range. Many courses are focused on the needs of law enforcement and military. This pistol-focused class is designed for people who want to acquire real-world defensive pistol skill sets designed specifically for civilian carry.


YOU WILL LEARN: 

•How to select an appropriate firearm 
•How to manipulate your firearm as a defensive tool 
•How to shoot accurately and consistently and how to speed up consistent accuracy 
•Quickly clearing malfunctions when your firearm experiences them 

YOU WILL NEED: 

•A semi-automatic pistol and at least 2 magazines 
•200 rounds of ammunition
 •Ear and eye protection 
•A folding camp chair for your comfort 
•Money for lunch/bring your lunch 
•Proper attire for the weather and conditions 
•A hat and/or sunscreen is advisable 

***Please Note: all below equipment is available for rental/purchase as needed - try before you buy! Don't let a lack of gear stop you from taking this class!!!***

In self-defense, we only get one chance to do it right: the first time. We need to find out the realities of self-defense in a safe, controlled training environment where we get a "do-over" when our preparations or equipment fails. We do NOT want to find out what doesn't work in a dirty mall parking lot where failure means serious bodily harm or even death; we would much rather discover those deficiencies in our preparation and equipment in training so we won't have to fail when it matters! 

You will never be set up to fail in this course. Our staff is certified, friendly, competent, proficient, fun, and professional. This course is designed to improve you from the very first moment you step in our door, starting from any skill level, with your own equipment, because the edge that you acquire from training will translate to a life-saving difference when it matters most. Pay attention in class, apply what you learn, and you will succeed in every single exercise!

as I grew up I used to trade in trucks every year, sometimes life throws you curve's they don't expect. I guess at this point I simply can't afford this much truck. My wife and I are separating.

So what you see in the photos is 2009 Chevy Silverado.

.A nice set of floorboard liners will take care that pretty easy.

Outside the truck there may be a few small scratches and paint due to those morons we all know won't part far enough away from your vehicle to properly open their door. But this truck is super clean and in very good condition.
 I'm just being straight up about what I know is there

Other than that the truck really seriously is in excellent shape. I don't have a lot of cash right now but I did take it and get it cleaned up so that you can see how nice it looks.
